reviews.text: Well worth a visit, beautiful architecture.. beautiful place.. just very cold.. people very friendly
Lovely church. Peaceful. Nice staff. A reminder to us that both communities have their right to peace and quiet.
Such a great idea to host the event like a Belfast Fashion Week in this Cathedral. It looks fabulous from outside and inside
Being a paranormal investigatior , I love looking at these historical buildings . And finding out history, definitely worth a visit
Ignoring the cathedral but there’s some amazing street art here!

This place is all about superb photography. Don't let appearances mislead. A quick glance does not do justice and you will take away little. You need to work a bit at understanding the back stories of the photographers and their aims for particular projects. Staff on duty are knowledgeable and helpful and the exhibition space is usually peaceful, allowing contemplation. There are plenty pamphlets and books you can and should consult. This is a place to take time and to think yourself into the mind of the photographer - to understand to what he/she wishes to draw attention. Seldom disappoints. Afterwards, find your way to Clement's Coffee House and take time to reflect over a really good coffee and a stupendously generous pastry.

Fantastic gallery that changes display often. Simple layouts that don't feel cluttered and a great usage of space in the building. The atmosphere is very welcoming in here and staff are friendly and engaging. My favourite gallery in Belfast.
This is one of my favorite places in Belfast! The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, the classes are engaging, and the exhibitions are well curated.
Couldn't get in, it was closed. Early afternoon. Disappointing, was looking forward to seeing it.

One of Belfast's best galleries. Contemporary photography from local, national and international artists. A small gallery upstairs promotes emerging talent and they run an excellent programme of photography classes.
Very good library. Good range of books. Kids absolutely love it!

This is a beautiful historic building with a fine library.
I use it mostly for it music lending library which is extensive.
Nice coffee shop too.

I have come here many times to study however Saturday was the first time that I took a tour of the building. Really interesting, great history and very knowledgeable library staff. Was great to see it so busy in a time when libraries have been closing, so get along and support it! They are hoping to extend within the next few years in order to open up the vast array of archived newspapers and over-sized books that aren't on show at the moment. Will be a great draw for Belfast and should bring people in from far and wide who want to research or are just curious about their local history.
Librarians themselves too loud, please take your conversations outside, or whisper, just as the visitors would be expected to do.
Looks nice from the outside but I've never been inside since it seems to be always closed. Please thing about your opening hours.

My first visit to the Waterfront to see Nathan Carter also a first. Fantastic venue altho very big and could do with large screens. Very spacious in the foyer areas and plenty of room and comfort in the seats. Lovely views from the main bar and staff all friendly and helpful especially the lady who showed us to our seats in block Q. Will definitely go back.
Great venue in Belfast. I saw a  live band here. The acoustics were great and the sight lines are good. The bar is not too expensive and the theatre is kept clean and tidy.

On Sat 9 Mar I visited the Waterfront Hall for the Anton & Erin show. The performance was fantastic but I have to congratulate the staff at the Waterfront Hall. At short notice the duty manager was able to facilitate my wife and I to avail of a new area to view the show. This was due to my wife having to temporarily use a wheelchair. The floor staff could not have been more helpful. Great show and great service. Thank you.

It’s The Waterfront, what more is there to say, this place is amazing!! Seen many’s a performance here, always happy to go back.  Bathroom facilities are always clean, seats in the theatre are always well kept.  While there is bar facilities there I cannot say how good or pricey it is, having never used it.  Finally, the staff in all areas are very pleasant and well mannered, very professional, essentially what you’d expect from an establishment of this quality.
We came here for the quirky wedding show and really enjoyed it. Loved how the show was spread out over the 3 floors. It was a much more intimate setting and I liked that.

Beautiful campus.

As regards individual modules, lectures and tutorials, students should ask if they are being taught by permanent lecturers, PhD students or by individuals on other contracts etc. Ask about the type of contract (and how long or short is it).

In my opinion, ALL teaching and related activities such as grading/marking should be undertaken by staff of at least lecturer grade and only delegated to others when completely necessary (e.g. to cover sickness).
Peaceful place! Botanic gardens are really near, which makes it pleasant to make a break from studies

I was in this university in 60’s and happened to be in the student union (men) committee.it was during this period ladies and gentlemen unions merged into one union. A modern block of building was opened just in front of the main entrance of the university. I remember Saturday hops and snooker tables in the union. My most memorable time was playing in dramas in Whitla Hall and freshers week. Our union president was Michael. I met Prince Philip, Roger Moore and the first mp in the British House of Commons who happened to be an unmarried mother. Also met a few dignitaries from Southern Ireland. I have some snaps. I am now very nearly 81 and enjoy living with my old memories.

Conal Drain again, just wanted to say my very intellectual father went here, ended up being a mechanic from home, didn't even teach him right. That's what he said anyway. Haven't seen him in 10 years. Help.
Beautiful building.
A nice experience and the fact you can drink a beer makes it that little bit more enjoyable than than the average corporate cinema.  A small personal experience. Very enjoyable.
Great cinema, showing some good movies that aren't available elsewhere. Try to get here every couple of months. The cinema can be warm so make sure you can take a jumper off.
Very nice always like it here only cinema in Belfast where you can buy a beer to enjoy with the movie. Good selection of foreign films also. Volume was a little too loud on this visit.

Popular cinema. Reception staff coped well with sold out attendance. Quiet attentiveness of audience appreciated. 
Though I also enjoy poorly attended films...
Brilliant cinema and value. I love the setting and the staff are always lovely. I've been going to the QFT for years, and always return when I am in Belfast.

The botanic gardens are beautiful! Very well kept. I enjoyed the greenhouses too, such a variety of lovely plants. I can tell a lot of care goes in to looking after them. I wish there were some animals in the tropical house. Nice for an afternoon stroll.

Really blissful ..you can have a good walk here.
of course when the weather is good.. 
You can see a wide variety of flowers.. well maintained.

The Ulster museum at one corner for the park is definitely worth a visit...& there is no entry fee.
Wonderful gardens, and amazing hot houses. Beautifully set out.  And with the Ulster Museum on the grounds. Amazing.  All lovers of plant life, and Creation in general will enjoy time spent here.

Had a great day walking around the craft fair. Seen many spectacular flowers, massive vegetables and lots of stalls selling home made produces. The fudge was fantastic.

Found the Belfast ukelele jam group playing in a marquee. Wow great music.

Pleasant in the early Spring. The flowerbeds are full of vibrant colour. The hothouses are rich with blooms and scents. The lawns have not yet shaken off their winter rough and are damp, but not for long. The renovated tropical ravine is superb and the museum is nearby if it rains or you need a snack. If it's sunny, go and look at the herbacious borders; sit and listen to the bees at work.

Educational, informative, and a really nice historical museum. We enjoyed our tour there. There are so many things to see and know about! 
Highly recommend!

Really nice musuem with art, history and nature elements. Free to visit. Closed on Monday, open all other days. The museum is situated in the botanic gardens, also nice to visit! I spend about 1.5 hour admiring the exhibition's. There are also several discovery centers with a strong focus on smaller children and activities to do like drawing or experiments.

It's a nice little museum, definitely worth a visit (if you like museums of course). The fact that it's small is great, because you get to see everything and it doesn't take up too much time. They have interesting things to see and it's free to visit.

Lots to see and all for free. Really enjoyed my stay. Big thanks to the team making this possible. And a special thanks to the staff for taking their time to explain me a little more about Ireland's history.

Great compact Museum. Featuring local history and ongoing up to date traveling displays. At the moment there is "A life in drawing- Leonardo da Vinci." also the amazing "Game of Thrones Tapestry." The entry is free and has a cafe and a souvenir shop. We'll worth a visit. You'll want to keep coming back.

It was quiet when we went (beginning of April) and enclosures were shut, as was the tree top cafe. The giraffe and elephant area was great and good chimp area. Good new kids park. A fair price, for a good 4 hours.

Bitterly disappointed by the experience, thought it was badly gone down hill, not worth the entrance fee, to be honest, it has I feel been let into a bad state of repair, there is so much that needs to be done if it is to attract more people I know I would not  recommend in its present state to anyone not s bit of wonder the politicians are looking it closed.  It needs a serious amount of money injection to be brought back to the place it was that I remember as a child

Small but nice and welcoming, very clean and staff were excellent really friendly also very helpful. The food was really nice in the cafe. But to be noted the zoo is built on the side of a mountain so very steep hill's but the kids really enjoyed it especially the brilliant playground. 👍😊.

Had a great family day out, some parts needing attention and not all animals out. Great park for kids. Entrance staff and entrance tea room staff very friendly. However, cafe at the top of the park on hill was filthy and staff need to be trained in hygiene regards to touching face and hair then cups and food. Overall cafe was so bad we decided to not eat in it. This was disappointing as the rest of the zoo was a great day out.
I have been coming here since 1990, the atmosphere is spectacular. The food is great and the animals are well looked after. I really miss seeing Tina the elephant tho.
The very best service but i'm Very biased as I work there

Beautifully kept cemetery,  you could spend hours going round  the graves of so many brave woman and men of Ireland.. athal O’Byrne was an Irish singer, poet and writer. He joined the Gaelic League in Belfast and became a popular singer and storyteller. He was a stage manager of the ulster Theater and would even become involved with the IRA, likely a member of the military council. In 1921 O’Byrne travelled to America as a freelance journalist and opened a bookstore. He would return to Ireland after raising $100,000 for victims of the Belfast riots through White Cross. He was a devout Catholic and even interviewed the Pope. Known for his dandified dress style, Cathal remained a bachelor his entire life. O’Byrne suffered from a stroke one month before his death on 1 August 1957. He is remembered as an important figure in the Celtic revival in the North of Ireland. Charles Patrick “Charlie” Tully was a famous footballer of Celtic Football Club and Belfast Celtic. Charlie’s skill quickly earned him the reputation as a Celtic great after an outstanding performance against Rangers in a 3-1 victory at Celtic Park where it was reported ‘Tully dribbled about almost at will.’ ‘..The miraculous Irishman bewildered, badgered…. mesmerised Rangers..’ This catapulted Tully to the status of cult hero and the beginning of ‘Tully Mania’ when Tully cocktails were sold in pubs; Tully ties in shops and green Tully ice cream in cafes. He is hailed as one of Celtic’s best ever players.
Well worth the visit
A must see  peaceful cemetery well worth a walk around. There are so many things to learn and see here you could spend hours just walking around see all the memorial.

# I understand Miltown cemetery is separate from this but has close connections to this place
 Anyone aware of o'neill & co headstone specialists at the side of Miltown cemetery.

I had a phone call with them today and spoke to the lady of the business regarding a certain issue that was easily amended.

without going into detail of wot the issue was....during the phone call of around 2 minutes she told me I was telling her how to do her job and she hung up the phone mid sentence before I could finish.

so I rang back....I asked would it be possible to speak to someone else instead and she said that it was only her there and she again hung up.

30 seconds later my mobile rang and when I answered I asked who it was.....the voice said this is the lady's husband....wot is the issue....
I replied saying..."your wife told me she was alone in the office because I wanted to speak with someone else for I was very unhappy with how she spoke with me on the phone ".....he replied saying "I have just came into the office" (bearing in mind.....no lies....this was only 30 seconds lol )

as I went to tell him wot my first phone call was regarding he began to shout at me to "shut up"
"shut up"

I said excuse me....wot ? ( I was shocked ) 

he again replied "shut up" "shut up" & hung up the phone.

I rang back....I said how dare they treat a customer like that and I will be upto the office to complain in person.

up at the office the wife of the premises took out her mobile phone to record me.

I sat down in a chair whilst a guy who faguley knows my family stood in between me and the male owner who was leaning aggressively over the persons arm who knows my family whilst shouting in my face "who do you think you are...I am the owner....I can do what I want"

I got up off the chair....I found a piece of paper and pen on their desk....and I wrote down the simple adjustments that needed to be done in the first place as to my phone call earlier and I left....

I have made a phone call to the consumer rights and also to the local newspaper...
who both agree that how I was treated was extremely unprofessional and wrong.

whoever has read this I thank you for taking the time lol
I am just very shocked and still gobsmacked by this malpractice from O'Neill & co headstone specialists at Miltown.

thank you
The cemetery has come along way and is beautiful now opens till 4pm. Our deceased are at the back where the old trees and hedges have been removed well presented and very easy to find now.
Great place to take guides and brownies! Lots of activities and the house is beautiful.  Very clean and comfortable.  Food is amazing
Great venue for  workshop. Accommodation basic but clean. Again food was simple but tasty and adequate
What a Wonderful place for children and grown ups alike. Great for team building and personnel development.
Love this place it has brought me a lot of memory.It has a shop for leaders to brownies to get clothing and gifts .The grounds are lovely great for camp fire.
Brilliant facilities and caring staff

Obviously very well known in Belfast, but there's no hype about it, it's fully justified. Lovely decor and surroundings, loved the snugs (sadly didn't get in one) and a good range of beers - the Maggie's Leap was excellent. Staff very friendly too. Great pub!

Best bar in Belfast that I visited. Amazing decor, a rich history and outstanding bartenders. The drinks were spot on and the alliance is great. Only down side is there are only a few snugs so they are hard to get, first come first serve.

A really pretty bar, some lovely wood carving in places. It's basically one room but there are booths along one side and at the end where you can sit in with a dribk. Great range of beers. You will not be disappointed...

Been to the bar four times, 3 whilst working and usually with a few colleagues. The first three visits were back in 2004/5 and it was fantastic with two live bands playing at opposite ends, very lively and entertaining. This recent visit was with my wife during a touring holiday of the whole of  Ireland, Belfast was our starting point. The bar was busy, we got served quickly though, and luckily were able to jump into a timely vacated booth. These features are amazing and fun environs... We were then asked by a group of 5 ladies if they might join us the evening got better with loss of chat and interaction, bar staff popping their head in every once in a while to keep the beer wine and soft drinks flowing. The toilets were clean as was the booth. When needed the service at the bar was quick and friendly.... Perfect end to our evening visit to the wonderful city of Belfast, its Christmas market, restaurants and bars. Thank you.

The first time I’ve ever walked out of a bar. Pub was packed but no one seemed to be serving, waited at the bar 15 mins then got bored and left. One to avoid. Visited a few other bars in Belfast which were all really great. Just not this one

Firstly, I love the performances here, they're always great fun. It's a great evening out, situated by a train/bus station and surrounded by cheery pubs.
The inside of the building is beautiful, with a wonderfully painted ceiling.

There are three floors, as far as public access goes. There is a lift, but I'm not sure just how accessible seating arrangements are in the building.

I have found the seats to be quite uncomfortable and the safety to be slightly concerning. In the Gods, for example, a small metal bar seems to be the only thing keeping you from plummeting down to the tier below. The seats are uncomfortably close to one another, making viewing slightly unpleasant.

Air conditioning and heating in the building, without a joke, blows hot and cold. I often feel far too warm just as the show begins, then freezing cold midway. 

Despite these issues, I honestly love visiting this place, the shows are always really good, acoustics are great, and service is usually friendly.

I had a wonderful experience at the Grand Opera House. It was like going back in time as the theatre itself seems like it hadn't changed for hundreds of years. Having said that everything was clean and well maintained. I feel like I was bitten by the bug of live theatre and I will definitely be back. Pro tip come early to soak up the atmosphere, the drinks seemed cheaper than the near by pubs too.

The performance was very fast moving & the cast were in top form. Very funny & some hilarious moments.
Audience were very relaxed & appeared to enjoy every moment along with the music.
Enjoyable evening.

Watched give my head peace, great show. Lovely building and the staff were very friendly and professional. Seats we had were a bit cramped for those with legs and feet and over 5' tall. Great experience though I'll be back again.

Beautiful venue, with good views from all areas. Staff are always helpful and we'll informed.It is small so you can't expect to see shows with a massive stage setup there. If you ever have a chance to do their backstage tour during the summer I'd really recommend it
Best burrito place in all of Belfast. A wide variety of stuff for every palate
Friendly staff and quick service! Was very busy but the line was going quickly. Food was very good with generous portions.
Boojum always full of that good s**t! Burritos, fajitas, rice bowls all tasty gear and not too heavy on the wallet for the fill you get
Love love love this place, any time we are in Belfast, this place is a must. LOVELY STAFF as well
Supergood too. Excellent food. Great retreat in Oriental style. Dont miss the xtra Te and Coffee, handmade and oriental

Obviously very well known in Belfast, but there's no hype about it, it's fully justified. Lovely decor and surroundings, loved the snugs (sadly didn't get in one) and a good range of beers - the Maggie's Leap was excellent. Staff very friendly too. Great pub!

Best bar in Belfast that I visited. Amazing decor, a rich history and outstanding bartenders. The drinks were spot on and the alliance is great. Only down side is there are only a few snugs so they are hard to get, first come first serve.

A really pretty bar, some lovely wood carving in places. It's basically one room but there are booths along one side and at the end where you can sit in with a dribk. Great range of beers. You will not be disappointed...

Been to the bar four times, 3 whilst working and usually with a few colleagues. The first three visits were back in 2004/5 and it was fantastic with two live bands playing at opposite ends, very lively and entertaining. This recent visit was with my wife during a touring holiday of the whole of  Ireland, Belfast was our starting point. The bar was busy, we got served quickly though, and luckily were able to jump into a timely vacated booth. These features are amazing and fun environs... We were then asked by a group of 5 ladies if they might join us the evening got better with loss of chat and interaction, bar staff popping their head in every once in a while to keep the beer wine and soft drinks flowing. The toilets were clean as was the booth. When needed the service at the bar was quick and friendly.... Perfect end to our evening visit to the wonderful city of Belfast, its Christmas market, restaurants and bars. Thank you.

The first time I’ve ever walked out of a bar. Pub was packed but no one seemed to be serving, waited at the bar 15 mins then got bored and left. One to avoid. Visited a few other bars in Belfast which were all really great. Just not this one

Wrong order. Guy beside got the wrong order a few times he was not amused. Came with chips, charged for chips, when taking order "Do you want chips with that?" "No"?? Doorsteps was always so good for fresh, clean sandwiches, it's not like that anymore. We won't be back again.
Been coming here on and off for 20 years. Great sandwiches but their prices have been fairly hiked up. Not the good value it once was.
Great value.....good for a quick & wholesome lunch
Good food, lovely staff. The toilet could do with a cleaning though!!
Quite simply the best sarnie shop in the country. The sarnies are so big, I nearly dislocated my jaw the other week trying to eat one. If you want a good feed, get yourself over to Doorsteps pronto!

Little Italy claims to be the best pizza in Belfast, now that is a hard to live up to standard to set, how many fall to claim that.

However in this case from my perspective, its true.

Their pizzas are made in great time, are incredibly value priced, and are some of the most tasty pizzas I've genuinely tried.

Understand that no these are not gourmet pizzas, however the incredible taste of these with insane value orientated pricing, makes them in my eyes, the best pizzas in Belfast.

When you decide to get pizza at 1am in a city you don’t know at all you are really not expecting that it will be this good. Oh god it was so good. They are open till 2 and the choice is amazing. Beware of the garlic mayo, it is fantastic but will stick with you! The crowds and queue at 1am showed how good this pizza really is.
I have got food from here quite a few times. Great for when you have been out drinking alcohol and need some food. Even though its very busy the staff are very helpful and professional.
Great and historic pizza take away with a taste Sensation no matter what one you pick.

Nicest pizza ever, very professional staff, dealt with drunken customers admirably,  especially the young girl who kept a smile on her face the whole time, they all deserve a gold medal in dealing with the public.
The best place for a fry. The milkshakes are pretty spectacular too. I have been going to Maggie Mays for years, and enjoy heading to one of the cafes when I visit now.

Nice food but as it doesn't allow card payments or split payment of bills it has to receive 3. This policy put me off returning as I had to go to an Atm after arriving so to enjoy food with my friends.

They made us wait outside to be seated for quite a while on a snowy and chilling weather whereas we were just 2 and there were several tables already available. Didn't even allow us to wait in the hallway for ""security reasons"" and never attended us eventually while passing in front of us... (thanks, guys...). Plus, note that you can ONLY pay by cash (no credit card accepted).

This Café doesn't support card and didn't have Soya milk when I went. BUT. For the price of the food, the taste of the food and the amount of the food it was fabulous! Also we got a huge VEGAN milkshake to share! Yes, I said a Vegan milkshake with vegan ice cream and vegan milk. Please go to this place! (but bring cash).
It's easy to see why people queue to get in. Excellent food with friendly and fast service. Great prices as well.

First visit here with my wife in Belfast  Weatherspoons. Considering how busy it was the staff were very helpful and friendly!! Our food was delivered quick, both our meals were tasty and delicious. So a big well done to the The Bridge House!! Looking forward until the next time we come back to Belfast!!

This Wetherspoons us just round the corner from our hotel. It's friendly, food good quality quick staff helpful. Very busy of course but that just adds to the atmosphere. 
We go every night .

Bit noisy but what can you expect for a busy place.... have stopped ordering food though as it seems to come out cold every time! When busy it seems staff are short and it seems food is left longer than should be after it has been cooked.

Food good, drink good BUT very noisy! Can't hear the person sitting next to you. Is it just that Belfast women screech a lot? Been to plenty of Wetherspoons but this was by far the noisiest. Went for 2 nights and both were as bad as each other. NOT the place for a quiet drink. The food and drink were good and reasonably priced but the noise!!!!

Very good prices and food for a fair price. They offer a big variety of drinks and food. Service was also good and quick. The girl of the bar was friendly and help You need to choose your table and go to the bar to ask for your order (so have in mind your table number). We ordered the food and the drinks and the system calculated the best price based on current promotions. Service is not very personalized, I would say between a restaurant and a fast good (maybe not ideal for romantic dated), however, this is very common in the UK and I don't see it negative. You even have some games machines and a bar area. In fact, it  was better for us. You order, you pay, you get your order and you go (no need to wait for the bill or anything). I would come back!

Went for lunch today £6.95 for three course,very good value. The dim sum is very good and its extra and very nice. Very good service. Staff very friendly I would recommend lunch. I will definitely be back soon! 😊

Service is always fast and courteous.  Food quality is good. The large number of Chinese patrons would indicate to me that this is the real deal if you wish to experience a decent Chinese meal. Give me a like if you found this helpful.

I never write a review but my experience was so bad that I have to comment. The manager was so rude when i explained I received the wrong food. When I received the correct dish there was hair in the food. I cannot day they did it on purpose for sure but it’s very suspicious. Avoid at all costs!!

Always good. Special 3 course lunch til 4pm only 6.99 is fab value and quality is superb.
Been here many times. Nice staff.
Many Chinese people here eating dumplings.

Chinese restaurant with traditional Chinese afternoon tea bites for lunch. Their dim sum menu didn’t have as much variety or flavour as expected. Prices are reasonable, service was quick, fast and friendly, however the food really lacks flavour. I wouldn’t recommend their lunch. 

However we went for dinner and their menu and food was amazing. The food was delicious and mouth watering.

Good range of dishes on menu reasonably priced..did not like table for 4 we were given requested another table and were reseated without any fuss. On lots of levels.. toilet top floor so not recommended for anyone with mobility issues..staff helpful and relaxed.

Scallini's high standards are being well maintained. A good family atmosphere with a layout and service that copes easily for couples as well as groups. One of the best places to eat in Botanic Avenue.

Having eaten rather a lot of Italian food I can honestly say that this is one of the better Italian restaurants that I eaten in. Great food and generous portions. Very well staffed so the service was fast and friendly, highly recommended.

Had such a lovely meal in here tonight would definitely recommend the arancini balls they were so tasty! Staff were on the ball and lovely restaurant was packed had a bit of a wait for a table.....was worth it 👍🏼
Had a nice soup and then a lovely steak god it was fantastic. Staff more than helpful cheers gals. X
Great spot for decent well poured guiness. Watched footy with my daughter and enjoyed no fuss decent bar food served by attentive professional friend staff. Whats not to love ? Paul
Nice update on the Kings head. Great service, just felt that the food for the money could have been a little better
Pint of Guinness ,pkt of crisps and a black coffee. £8:30. The place was empty on the last day of the month. Wonder why.
Drinks + service good today.... Lite bite was poor (Chillies beef....meat to fresh):-(
My friend and I had a lovely breakfast with very pleasant staff. Recommend it.😂

Food lovely. We ate from the set menu our party of 3 ordered Burger and two lamb dishes all of them were very nice however we were advised to get a side order with  the lamb.  Without the side order we would have been hungry. Service was very good and overall a lovely experience we will be back. Lovely friendly atmosphere.

Very very tasty dinner! Thank you chefs! 
We had been welcomed by a manager and he was very professional and thanks to him we had such a great experience. We had special of the day - duck and a ribeye steak :) all was amazing! Thank you
42 years married today. Just home from an amazing meal in Dean's. Would recommend it big time. Lovely place, great staff and amazing food. Loved it

Very reasonably priced. However the menu has changed and the prices have increased.  Still good value. I still prefer the old style French fries as now they have chunky chips which are a bit common. Come on bring the fries back.

The only thing wrong with this superb place - and that thing is not their fault at all - is that yobs come in here and throw money around and then some get very drunk.  It makes me very sad that these young ‘men’ think that they rule the roost, when they are actually just very sad.  Anyway, Deanes - eject those loudmouth ‘Rubes’ and let us enjoy your overcrowded, over-priced burger joint in peace.

This place is horrible.  The food is pretty decent, the bar staff are nice, the manager (when I stayed there anyway) is a kind gentleman, so why am I against the place?  The thing that destroys it are the ‘bouncers’ / security staff.  They are horribly rude and I will never stay in this place again.  I will go out of my way to recommend people do not stay here, and any time someone says, “let’s go to RBG”, I will make sure to say, “No!”

This was the first time I'd eaten here and it was an oasis in the Friday Christmas lunch madness!  It had its usual menu on and wasnt too busy.  Plenty of choice on the menu and good, reasonably priced, tasty grub ... can't ask for much more!
Food came promptly,  hot and tasty. Great value
Brilliant staff very welcoming and great atmosphere
Really nice food and staff

Obviously very well known in Belfast, but there's no hype about it, it's fully justified. Lovely decor and surroundings, loved the snugs (sadly didn't get in one) and a good range of beers - the Maggie's Leap was excellent. Staff very friendly too. Great pub!

Best bar in Belfast that I visited. Amazing decor, a rich history and outstanding bartenders. The drinks were spot on and the alliance is great. Only down side is there are only a few snugs so they are hard to get, first come first serve.

A really pretty bar, some lovely wood carving in places. It's basically one room but there are booths along one side and at the end where you can sit in with a dribk. Great range of beers. You will not be disappointed...

Been to the bar four times, 3 whilst working and usually with a few colleagues. The first three visits were back in 2004/5 and it was fantastic with two live bands playing at opposite ends, very lively and entertaining. This recent visit was with my wife during a touring holiday of the whole of  Ireland, Belfast was our starting point. The bar was busy, we got served quickly though, and luckily were able to jump into a timely vacated booth. These features are amazing and fun environs... We were then asked by a group of 5 ladies if they might join us the evening got better with loss of chat and interaction, bar staff popping their head in every once in a while to keep the beer wine and soft drinks flowing. The toilets were clean as was the booth. When needed the service at the bar was quick and friendly.... Perfect end to our evening visit to the wonderful city of Belfast, its Christmas market, restaurants and bars. Thank you.

The first time I’ve ever walked out of a bar. Pub was packed but no one seemed to be serving, waited at the bar 15 mins then got bored and left. One to avoid. Visited a few other bars in Belfast which were all really great. Just not this one
